_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary



Dakota Yeast LLC (Dakota Yeast; formerly the Minn-Dak Yeast Company) is committed to the protection of its employees, the greater community and the environment from any hazardous substances used in its yeast manufacturing process, specifically aqueous ammonia.  It is the policy of Dakota Yeast LLC to comply with all Federal, State and Local laws.





Facility Description and Regulated Substances Handled



Dakota Yeast operates a yeast manufacturing facility located in Wahpeton, Richland County, North Dakota.  Aqueous ammonia, at 30% concentration, is a key component in the manufacture of yeast as a nitrogen source.  Liquid ammonia is fed into the sealed process and is completely consumed during the process.  The maximum amount of aqueous ammonia stored on-site is 120,000 pounds.  No other regulated substances are handled in excess of the RMP threshold quantities. 





General Accident Release Prevention Program



Through completion of this RMP, and through implementation and maintenance of the program manual and the program itself, Dakota Yeast has complied with the EPA requirements under 40 CFR Part 68.  Process safety information and operations/maintenance procedures are documented on site and updated as needed.  Periodic functions such as hazard reviews, training, compliance audits, and incident investigation are conducted on a regular basis as needed and in accordance with the required frequencies in the rule.





Five-Year Accident History



No ammonia accidents causing death, environmental or property damage, evacuations, or in-place sheltering have occurred in the last five years at the facility.





The Emergency Response Program



In the event of an emergency, it is a policy of Dakota Yeast to notify the local (Dwight Township Fire Department and/or City of Wahpeton) Fire Departments and evacuate all employees from the facility.  Dakota Yeast is a non-responding facility.  The process has a distributed control system (DCS) that

allows for remote shut-off of pumps and closure of automatic valves for the aqueous ammonia system.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety



Dakota Yeast will continue to coordinate with local emergency responders so there is familiarity in the event of an emergency.
